intro: Meryta macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf meryta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Pacific, including parts of Hawaii and the Cook Islands. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by bright red berries. Meryta macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained, moist soils.
